thread.title: 'Deal with it' reporter is everyone's new favorite reaction GIF
thread.title_full: 'Deal with it' reporter is everyone's new favorite reaction GIF

author: Sasha Lekach
title: 'Deal with it' reporter is everyone's new favorite reaction GIF
text:
A magical moment from a recent White House press briefing was caught in GIF form , and it's just oozing perfect reaction goodness.
Behold, a White House reporter and IRL "Deal with it" meme guy John Gizzi:
The Newsmax senior political correspondent's smooth moves from Friday's briefing were being applauded all over the internet by Monday. People just couldn't get enough of his glasses flick and eager crowd scan — he seemed to be checking whether anyone had noticed his masterpiece.
SEE ALSO: Meryl Streep's hilarious reaction to that Oscars mix-up is the perfect meme for 2017
The GIF quickly became everyone's favorite reaction meme of the week and hopefully forever. Gizzi also rocks an awesome hat in his LinkedIn profile pic , making him even more of a national treasure.
Has anyone done this? @johngizzi pic.twitter.com/dfGA9dOu5m
— Frank Thorp V (@frankthorp) March 13, 2017
Best GIF this week (and it's only Monday afternoon!) comes via @johngizzi . pic.twitter.com/s62xbkhlYR
— T. Becket Adams (@BecketAdams) March 13, 2017
Ah, I found my new go-to reaction gif. Thanks, @johngizzi . pic.twitter.com/jzQTAXjeGe
— Lachlan Markay (@lachlan) March 13, 2017
As a former Gizzi intern, I can tell you he's been doing this for 17 years at least. https://t.co/Qgp1ugFXm6
— Ben Domenech (@bdomenech) March 13, 2017
Gizzi himself retweeted several tweets about his "deal with it"-like moves.
See the moment for yourself at minute 24 at Friday's briefing — which we can't forget also included hilarious drama over Press Secretary Sean Spicer's upside-down American flag pin .
